field.label: Display Tracking Number as Barcode
field.tooltip: When set to "Yes", the shipping tracking number will be displayed as a barcode.

field.label: Store Address
field.tooltip: Enter your store's address as you would like it to appear in the pdfs. This field can also be used for free text.

field.label: Order Comments
field.tooltip: When set to All, comments inputted under Sales > Orders > Comment History will be added to the pdf (the comments you see in the back-end order view history).

field.label: Display Total Weight
field.tooltip: When set to Yes, the total weight will be displayed. This setting may be useful for shipping purposes.

field.label: Display Base and Order Currency
field.tooltip: When set to No, pdfs will always display the order currency. When set to Yes, pdfs will display the base currency in addition to order currency.

field.label: Display detailed Tax Summary
field.tooltip: When set to Yes, the pdf document will include details of tax is applied to items.

field.label: Default Bundle Display
field.tooltip: When set to No, bundle items of a fixed price bundle will include more details

field.label: Title
field.tooltip: Enter a title for the order pdf.

field.label: Customer Addresses
field.tooltip:
Which addresses should appear on the pdf? Choose from shipping address, billing address or both. Note that downloadable product orders won't have a shipping address.

If the customer VAT number is entered during checkout, this will be shown as part of the billing address by default.

Swapping around the order of the billing and shipping addresses is possible – see the Developer Bonuses section for more information.

You can customise the customer address format by accessing System > Configuration > Customer Configuration > Address Templates > Pdf. The | character will be converted into a line break.

field.label: Columns
field.tooltip:
Use the add button to add additional columns you want to display in the pdf. Choose from:
  • Position (orders the products automatically by adding a number)
  • Product name
  • SKU
  • SKU barcode (displays the SKU as a barcode)
  • Product image
  • Price
  • Discount
  • Qty
  • Tax
  • Subtotal
  • Supported Product Attributes
There is no maximum number, but the more columns you select, the smaller they will become in order to fit on the same page.

Use the Custom Title column to change the title for the column

Use the Custom Width column to change the relative width of a column (empty = use default width for the column type). Default values range between 12 and 28.

field.label: Custom Text
field.tooltip: Add custom text to appear at the bottom of the pdf. Use free text or simple html.

field.label: Use Integrated Labels
field.tooltip:
Select “Yes” to use integrated labels. Each label measures 85mm x 54mm. Labels measure positioned 20mm from the side and 23mm from bottom.

Choose from the following standard labels:
• Single – Shipping Address Label
• Single – Billing Address Label
• Double – Shipping and Billing Addresses

field.label: Title
field.tooltip: Enter a title for the shipment pdf.

field.label: Print Order as Packing Slip
field.tooltip:
When set to Yes, you can bypass the standard workflow requirement by printing packing slips without first having to create a Magento shipment. You can do this regardless of order status. However, you will lose the ability to print the packing slips with the shipment number (the order number is used instead).

Use this setting if you are getting the following error message: "There are no printable documents related to selected orders"
